column4: hey can any one tell me any good book to learn Ubuntu  from starting level to advanced level
just use the OS. It will teach you a lot more than any document or book can show you
its like these admins who do a lot of courses but are rubbish when it comes to real life systems. Books only show you so much. Using the system will teach you more and will teach you better
that's is a windows app so is no use to you. You are using ubuntu which isn't windows
is there any way to install that .exe file in ubuntu?
there's wine but if its a driver file then its of no value to you whatsoever
yes but is it a software or a driver or what?
it is a driver for digital pen
then its no good to you. You need a linux driver. That is a windows driver. The cd is worthless to you
websearch for the model of the pen in conjunction with linux. Also check the ubuntu hcl
chmod +r filename   will give read access to a file (or folder)
logging in as root isn't advised nor supported
dpkg -l | grep gnome | grep lib     should do it
